definition: lit. drink the northwest wind (idiom); cold and hungry
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: I just knew that our sales sucked wind and we were burning through tons of cash.
sentences.chinese: 我只知道公司一邊在大量燒錢而另一邊卻在喝西北風。

sentences.english: The bosses expect their workmen to live on air.
sentences.chinese: 這些老闆指望他們的工人喝西北風過日子。

sentences.english: You are not going to stand me up again, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不會再讓我喝西北風吧？
